snippet: H. F. Ahmanson & Company took a big step yesterday to enlarge its California presence with a deal to buy Coast Federal Savings for about $901 million in stock.    The acquisition would vault Ahmanson, based in Irwindale, Calif., and the parent of ...
lead_paragraph: H. F. Ahmanson & Company took a big step yesterday to enlarge its California presence with a deal to buy Coast Federal Savings for about $901 million in stock. The acquisition would vault Ahmanson, based in Irwindale, Calif., and the parent of Home Savings of America, to third place among California banks behind BankAmerica and Wells Fargo.
abstract: H F Ahmanson & Co, parent of Home Savings of America, will buy Coast Federal Savings for $901 million in stock; acquisition will vault Ahmanson to third place among California banks behind BankAmerica and Wells Fargo; merger will also bump Washington Mutual down to fourth-largest California bank; this is Ahmanson's first purchase of another financial institution since it lost fight for Great Western Financial Corp to Washington Mutual Inc this year (M)

headline.main: Ahmanson In Deal for Coast Federal
